description: NATO countries are required to spend 2% of their GDP on defense, but most countries, except the US, fail to meet this requirement. This allows the US to exert influence over NATO decisions and potentially manipulate investigations.
original:
Forwarded from: KB. economy
NATO countries' defense spending or the story of how to lose sovereignty.

As you can see from the graph, the United States bears almost all of NATO's expenses. Which seems to be unfair and which Trump constantly reminds us of when he threatens to leave NATO.

But there is an important nuance.

If you read the charter, NATO countries must spend 2% of GDP on defense. That is, for Germany the figure should not be $68 billion as in the photo, but about a hundred. The same applies to other countries - almost no one except the United States spends the coveted 2%.

Why is the United States happy with everything?

Everything is very simple - low spending on defense and violation of the NATO charter can always be remembered when pushing for the next decision. Well, or when the United States blows up your own gas pipeline on your own territory and asks you to close the investigation.

description: A mining training center, 'KuprUM', was opened in a secondary school in the Kalarsky district in partnership with the Udokan Copper company. The center aims to train specialists in blue-collar professions and engineering personnel, providing students with skills in mining, metallurgy, software, 3D modeling, robotics, and VR technologies.
original:
A mining training center opened in a secondary school in the Kalarsky district in partnership with the Udokan Copper company. Alexander Osipov opened a new training center "KuprUM", which in the Kalarsky district in partnership created the Trans-Baikal Mining College named after. M.I. Agoshkova and the Udokan Copper company.

To prevent the lack of specialists from becoming a barrier to industrial growth in Transbaikalia, enterprises cooperate with Transbaikal State University (ZabSU).

The Udokan Copper company has created a paid internship program: ZabSU students in mining areas who combine university studies with work at enterprises will be able to count on scholarships of up to 150 thousand rubles.

And in the Kalarsky district, with the support of the Udokan Copper company, a specialized training center “KuprUM” was opened on the basis of secondary school No. 2 to train specialists in blue-collar professions and engineering personnel.

Students in grades 6-11 can get acquainted with the basics of mining and metallurgy, gain skills in using software, 3D modeling, robotics and VR technologies (virtual reality, VR - virtual reality technology).

The center is equipped with training simulators for operating mining equipment, a simulation simulator for open-pit mining, and laboratory and practical sets with natural samples of mineral resources are installed here.#Transbaikalia

event: Establishment of Orders of Ushakov and Nakhimov
description: On March 3, 1944, the Presidium of the USSR Armed Forces established two new naval orders: the Order of Ushakov and the Order of Nakhimov. These orders were created during the Great Patriotic War to recognize outstanding achievements in maritime operations.
original:
Forwarded from: History.RF
On March 3, 1944, by decree of the Presidium of the USSR Armed Forces, two new orders were established: the Order of Ushakov, I and II degrees, and the Order of Nakhimov, I and II degrees.

The decision was made during the Great Patriotic War, since there have never been purely naval orders in the award system of our country; in previous eras, both generals and naval commanders were awarded according to a single system. Both medals are preserved in the award system of the Russian Federation unchanged.

The Order of Ushakov became the senior naval order. Awarded for outstanding achievements in the development, conduct and support of maritime active operations. The Order of Nakhimova, younger than the Order of Ushakov, is nevertheless recognized as one of the most beautiful and rare orders of the Soviet Union. Subscribe to History.RF

event: Death of Intelligence Chief Slava Vykhodnoy

Forwarded from: Española | Military organization "Hispaniola". OF.
Simultaneously with great victories, even greater mourning came to the house of Hispaniola, and this is not only our tragedy, but that of the entire Russian OF movement.

Today is a dark day for all of us.

While carrying out a combat mission with a weapon in his hands, the intelligence chief of the Espanyola brigade, Slava Vykhodnoy, died. It turned out that this was his last business trip.

We all know, not in words, that misfortune in war lurks behind every bush; sudden danger awaits any of us around every turn; but we all firmly understand why we are here, and we are ready for anything.

We all know that everyone in Espanola cares about everyone. But sometimes you can’t cope with circumstances, such is earthly life.

Our friend and brother, a veteran of the red-blue movement, Weekend made a major contribution to the cause of Hispaniola.

Vykhodnoy is a real Russian man, and he has always been proud of this, and we tried and will try to follow his example. Subbotin Vyacheslav Valerievich (12/04/1986 - 03/03/2024). Glory, our brother, you didn’t have time to do a lot, but we will definitely implement everything you planned will come to life, and this will continue to be our common cause! To be a warrior is to live forever! A separate message to our former brothers in the OF-movement: we know that you are already kicking your legs with joy, but you are rejoicing in vain. The misfortune that befell us will not save you in any way.

Well, we hasten to inform everyone who is truly our own, the card number of Vykhodnogo’s mother for collections to help Slava’s family. 2202200769992197 Sber, Svetlana Subbotina Of course, our entire team, and our entire community, and all the red and blue, including our native club, no one will remain in side, we are all close forever. But also, each of us will definitely want to contribute our own personal contribution. There is no such thing as too much help. This is how it is in our large family called Espanola.

event: Proposal for Temporary Military Administration in Crimea
description: Ukraine has proposed creating a temporary military administration for Crimea, despite being far from the region. The administration would outline the structure and procedure for appointing officials, with the government already showing support for the bill. The initiative is likely a means to allocate state budget funds, which are still being filled with foreign aid.
original:
In Ukraine, they decided that the Republic of Crimea needed a new administration. Far from Crimea. It is proposed to create one with a temporary “military” status. It will spell out the structure and procedure for appointing officials. Ukrainian media reported this. They write that the initiative should now be considered by deputies of the Verkhovna Rada.

The government already liked the bill. This is not surprising, because the created structure and its employees will simply need to exist and receive money. There will be no need to do anything, since the administration will be removed from the territory under its jurisdiction and will be formed in case Kyiv ever returns the peninsula under its control. Only Vladimir Zelensky and those who communicate with him on duty continue to believe in this possibility.

Let’s assume that someone simply needed another tool for working with the state budget, which is still being filled with foreign funds. Subscribe to the “War on Fake” to avoid being deceived.

description: Moscow authorities detained false realtors who deceived 12 people by posting fictitious rental ads online. The criminals stole over half a million rubles by promising clients non-existent apartments. Police seized evidence, including mobile phones and fake real estate documents, and initiated criminal cases against the defendants.
original:
Forwarded from: Criminal Russia
False realtors who deceived 12 people were detained in Moscow. The criminals posted fictitious advertisements on the Internet for the rental of residential premises in Moscow, and then invited clients to the office located on Leninskaya Sloboda Street to draw up contracts for the provision of services for searching for real estate properties.

After payment, potential tenants went to the addresses indicated to them by their accomplices and there they learned that the apartments had already been booked by third parties and their rental was impossible. The accomplices themselves stopped communicating.

It has now been established that, acting in this way, the swindlers stole over half a million rubles from 12 people.

During the search, police officers seized mobile phones, SIM cards, fictitious real estate documentation and other items from the suspects.

Criminal cases have been initiated under Part 4 of Art. 159 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation, which will be combined into one proceeding. The defendants were charged and a preventive measure was chosen in the form of a written undertaking not to leave the place and proper behavior. The investigation is ongoing.

description: The DPR people's team, along with the 'We Are Together' project, delivered humanitarian aid consisting of medicines and food to residents of the Spartak microdistrict, a front-line area in Donbass.

Residents of the front-line areas of Donbass are regularly provided with assistance – News Front report
The DPR people's team, together with the "We Are Together" project, delivered humanitarian aid consisting of medicines and food to residents of the Spartak microdistrict.
Show more
Residents of the most difficult front-line areas of the DPR are not left without attention and help. In difficult conditions, often with a complete lack of electricity, gas and water, people still do not leave their homes.
Humanitarian assistance to those who refused to evacuate and spent all the years of fighting in Donbass at the front is provided not only by local administrations, but also by volunteers. Among them are the People’s Druzhina of the DPR, which recently celebrated its fifth anniversary, and volunteers of the all-Russian project “We are together.”
The day before, with another humanitarian cargo, they visited the village of Spartak, which is located near Donetsk. For a long time, the settlement was actually on the front line, since it was it that separated the capital of the DPR from Avdeevka, which was then occupied by Ukrainian troops.
“I am Russian in all respects, no matter what anyone says. Thank you so much, there are no words to express my gratitude. God grant them long life and family happiness,” a resident of Spartak addresses volunteers and military personnel.

description: A counter-terrorism operation was conducted by the National Anti-Terrorism Committee in the Republic of Ingushetia, resulting in the neutralization of six ISIS adherents. description: The US Air Force conducted the first flight of the XQ-67A drone, a low-cost support aircraft developed by General Atomics Aeronautical Systems. The drone is designed to support manned aircraft and is part of the 'built-in loss concept', which aims to quickly create cheap devices for destruction.
original:
Forwarded from: Aerotetrahedron | No safety limit
🛫First flight of General Atomics support drone The US Air Force conducted the first flight of the XQ-67A drone from General Atomics Aeronautical Systems (GA-ASI). This was another step towards creating a low-cost support aircraft. The ultimate goal is to create low-cost autonomous aircraft that can support manned aircraft.

The drone is a successor to the Kratos XQ-58A Valkyrie, sharing a common chassis design called the "rod", which allows for standardization of airframes, but at the same time quickly integrating different capabilities, such as adding a sensing system.

The UAV represents the second generation of the so-called “built-in loss concept.” Its meaning is to quickly create cheap devices that are designed for destruction. The proof of concept was the early XQ-58. General Atomics itself is among five aerospace companies selected by the US Air Force to develop autonomous fighters that will support sixth-generation manned combat aircraft. Aerotetrahedron|#drones

description: The Russian Orthodox Church has requested land in a park area in Krasnodar's city center for temple construction. The site, previously owned by a former regional administration official's family, was recently cleared of buildings. Public hearings are underway, but local activists fear officials may disregard citizen opinions and allow the church to take over the land.
original:
In Krasnodar, they plan to build a temple in a park area in the city center. The Russian Orthodox Church asked the Krasnodar Land Use Commission to transfer land inside the park area on Zaton for religious ceremonies. The locals call this territory the “dacha” or “mansion” of the former deputy head of the regional administration, Akhedzhak: 15 years ago they began to build a hotel there, but then the land was transferred to the ownership of the father of the ex-head of the administration. In 2022, Akhedzhak’s daughter demanded through the court that the inherited land be bought from her for 304 million rubles, because according to the new laws she could not continue construction there. And in January 2024, all the buildings of the former “dacha” were demolished, and now the church claims the site.

The Kuban diocese demands a change in the type of use of 1.6 hectares of land. The mayor's office has announced public hearings on this matter, which will end on March 13. Then all local objections must be considered by the land use commission. According to social activists, officials may not take into account the opinions of citizens - recent changes in the city’s land use rules allowed the construction of churches not only in residential areas, but also on the territory of educational, sports, cultural facilities and in parks.

“The mayor’s office will sign a resolution, and a religious site will appear in the park area on the banks of the Kuban instead of the declared pedestrian and bicycle routes. Maybe it would be easier to cut all the parks in Krasnodar into sections and divide them between the vice-governors and the Russian Orthodox Church? Why all this circus with “public discussions”?” writes local activist Vitaly Cherkasov.

original: 🇷🇺❤️🐕Heavy video: The dog died while saving Russian soldiers from an attack drone🔞🔞The dog “Dooby” attached himself to the soldier Eric on the Kherson front and became his own. He was hectic, but loyal and fearless. Noticing that the fighters were running away from kamikaze drones, he clearly regarded this as a threat to his close comrades. And the next time, when another Ukrainian fpv flew into the position, people began to run away and hide, and he, “The Goonie,” rushed to defend his own: he rushed at the drone, grabbed it with his teeth... And died, not allowing the position to be attacked.. Tragic footage shows the last minutes of the life of “The Goonie” (not worth watching for the faint of heart). Fighter Eric lost his friend and became even more bitter towards the enemy. Now he considers it necessary to destroy the enemy with ammunition drops signed in honor of the hero dog. During the Great Patriotic War, animals showed an example of service worthy of admiration, probably without realizing it, but they performed real feats. There is even a practice in the world of awarding animals for such merits with medals and orders. For example, the dog Dzhulbars, who served in the 14th assault engineer brigade (1944 - 1945) and was able to help clear 7.5 thousand mines. Awarded the medal "For Military Merit". Was injured. And that’s why I couldn’t walk in the Victory Parade on Red Square. But upon learning of this, Stalin ordered the dog to be carried in his arms on his overcoat. I think that the faithful “Dumb”, who died in the Northern Military District, is worthy of at least our fond memory of him. Tell your friends about this feat.@RVvoenkor@zimenkin

description: The ongoing fighting in Ukraine has led to a severe environmental disaster, contaminating approximately a third of the territories with toxic elements from ammunition. These elements, including lead, cadmium, arsenic, and mercury, can leach into the soil and enter the food chain, posing a threat to global food security and the nation's health.
original:
Forwarded from: Governor General N
No longer a breadbasket. Ukraine is facing a terrible environmental disasterUkraine is experiencing a severe environmental disaster, writes RS. The fighting led to the contamination of approximately a third of the territories with toxic elements contained in ammunition.

"Toxic elements such as lead, cadmium, arsenic and mercury are leached from ammunition and weapons into the soil. If potential contamination areas are not identified and recorded in time, harmful substances can enter the food chain and become carcinogens. This, in turn, threatens the global food security and export opportunities. Finally, if immediate measures are not taken, this could undermine the health of the nation," the article says. One conclusion emerges: the grain harvest, which Ukraine is now trying to sell off by hook or by crook, is the last for many years to come.

description: Protesters gathered near the Chinese Embassy in Paris, demanding action against Chinese flayers who torture and abuse cats on camera for content. The protesters are concerned that the perpetrators may go unpunished due to local laws.
original:
In Paris, pickets are being held near the Chinese Embassy - protesters are demanding attention to Chinese flayers who steal cats and abuse them on camera. According to the protesters, the monsters may go unpunished due to local laws.

The uproar began after videos of kittens appeared online that looked exhausted and reacted strangely to food. They were tortured for the sake of content, some were even burned live. The rest are kept without food or water, left to slowly die.

The flayers valued the life of one of the kittens at $600 - for the sake of money, they planned to leave his body next to the living cats. Those who were concerned called him Mr. Fresh and managed to save.

Now mr. Fresh is safe, but the rest of the kittens are on the verge of death. According to users, the flayers have a chat with about 200 people. There they discuss their plans for the next kitten and decide how they will abuse it. Eyewitnesses are worried that no one will be punished for animal cruelty - in China there is no law that would regulate violence against animals.

Animal rights activists decided to act on their own. They created petitions and staged rallies outside the Chinese Embassy in Paris. They hope to create a stir so that the monsters will at least be fired from their jobs or expelled from universities.

description: In 2022, 989,000 people received EU citizenship, a 20% increase from 2021. Italy, Spain, and Germany granted the most citizenships, with the largest increases seen in Italy, Spain, and Germany.
original:
​​Ukrainians, Moldovans and Russians are among the top ten categories of foreigners who have received the most citizenships of EU member states, Eurostat reports.

In 2022, 989 thousand people received citizenship of the EU country in which they lived, which is approximately 20% (+163,100 people) more than in 2021.

The largest number of new citizenships (in absolute numbers) was granted by Italy (213,700; 22% of the total number of EU citizens). The second and third places in terms of the number of new citizenships are occupied by Spain (181,800; 18% of the total number of EU citizens) and Germany (166,600; 17%).

The largest increases in the number of citizenships granted to non-citizens in 2022 compared to 2021 were recorded in Italy (+92,200), Spain (+37,600) and Germany (+36,600). At the other end of the scale, the largest declines were recorded in France (-15,900), the Netherlands (-9,300) and Portugal (-3,700).

The data shows that 87% of all those granted EU citizenship by residence were citizens of a non-EU country. Citizens of an EU country other than the country of residence accounted for 12%. The rest either had an unknown previous citizenship (1%) or were stateless (0.7%).

description: A Pobeda Airlines Boeing 737-800 with 168 passengers on board nearly crashed during landing at Sochi airport due to severe thunderstorms. The pilots' inadequate reactions led to a loss of control, with the plane's roll reaching 49 degrees. Fortunately, the pilots managed to correct the situation and divert to an alternate airfield.
original:
“Fuck! Let's leave! A Boeing 737-800 of Pobeda Airlines with 168 passengers almost crashed during landing at Sochi airport. According to the commission’s conclusion, the plane’s roll reached 49 degrees, and due to the load, the pilots lost the ability to adequately react to the situation.

On December 23, 2023, the Pobeda plane flew from Kazan to Sochi. Already on approach to landing, the plane encountered a severe thunderstorm. According to the transcript of the negotiations, the 27-year-old co-pilot several times suggested that the 50-year-old commander go around, but he still did not dare to do so.

As a result, the PIC agreed to go around only when the plane encountered severe bumps. During a right turn, the plane's roll was more than 30 degrees, and for several seconds the crew did not correct this in any way. After this, the plane tilted several more times in different directions and almost went into a stall. The pitch was 20 degrees.

The plane itself, during the go-around, was flying at too low a speed, which could also lead to irreversible consequences.

As a result, according to the commission, the illiterate actions of the crew led to a short-term loss of control of the aircraft, and the workload on the crew increased so much that “their ability to analyze incoming information and respond adequately to it was lost.”

Fortunately, thanks to mechanical actions, the pilots managed to correct the situation and take the plane to an additional airfield.

After the investigation, the commander was transferred to co-pilot without the right to reinstatement as a PIC.

Thanks to the Aviatorschina telegram channel for the materials.

event: Priests Visit Soldiers of the West Group
description: Priests from the Krasnodar region visited soldiers of the West group in the Northern Military District zone, providing moral and spiritual support. They handed out gifts from local residents and conducted a field worship ceremony, allowing soldiers to receive communion without interrupting their service.
original:
Soldiers of the "West" group were visited by priests from the Krasnodar region. Servicemen of the "West" group of troops took part in a ceremony of worship in the field in the rear area of the Northern Military District zone. Priests from a church in one of the villages in the Krasnodar Territory came to visit the military personnel. “At an invitation from distant lands, we came to visit our familiar soldiers, provide moral and spiritual support, and physically, of course, to hand over small gifts from our village residents. ... In our church they make camouflage nets and trench candles, people bring gifts. For us, this is a very emotional and distant journey, because we feel that it is also necessary to provide this kind of support to our soldiers. ...,” said priest Nikita (Revyakin). The military personnel had the opportunity to receive communion without interrupting their military service. “At home in Murmansk, I regularly received communion. And now such an opportunity arose. Father came to us. I'm very happy about this. The awareness that someone is always nearby supports me, protects me,” says a serviceman of the “West” group of troops with the call sign “Murmansk.” Often, risking their lives, along with the soldiers, priests not only serve prayer services, but also give communion, they confess and baptize military personnel who have found faith. They not only perform services in field churches in the rear areas of the military operations, but also visit the soldiers located directly in the front lines.

Conversations with priests also have a strong positive impact on the morale of soldiers. They cannot do without the examples of our great Orthodox warriors and commanders: Alexander Nevsky, Dmitry Donskoy, Fyodor Ushakov. Russian Ministry of Defense

description: Tsarevich Nicholas II, accompanied by his family and associates, including Baroness Buchshoeveden, walked along the Dnieper River. The Tsarevich misbehaved, snatching the Baroness's umbrella and throwing it into the river. After being scolded by his father, the Tsarevich apologized and showed chivalrous attention to the ladies for several days.
original:
One day, Emperor Nicholas II, while at Headquarters, walked along the banks of the Dnieper with the Tsarevich and the Grand Duchesses. The royal family was accompanied by some close associates, including Baroness Buchshoeveden. The Tsarevich, who had been naughty all the way, at some point snatched the lady’s umbrella and threw it into the river. Together with Grand Duchess Olga, the Baroness tried to pull out the umbrella with branches, but they failed. Suddenly, Nicholas II approached the scene of the incident.

“What kind of performance?” he asked those present. Grand Duchess Olga told what happened and added that “this is a terrible shame,” since the Tsarevich threw the baroness’s best and most expensive umbrella into the river. The smile disappeared from Nikolai's face. The Tsar apologized to the Baroness and then told his son that he was ashamed of him. After this, Nicholas II rolled up his pants, entered the river and personally took out an umbrella. The Tsarevich, red with shame, approached the Baroness and apologized.

Subsequently, for several days he terribly amused everyone, showing signs of chivalrous attention to the ladies.

description: Ukrainian soldiers from the 3rd Assault Brigade described their panicked and disorganized retreat from Avdiivka. Fighters reported being abandoned in the city, witnessing artillery strikes on neighboring columns, and lacking combat experience. Many soldiers were wounded, and some were left behind without orders to retreat.
original:
Forwarded from: Operation Z: Military Correspondents of the Russian Spring
‼️🇺🇦☠️The retreat from Avdiivka “was panicked and disorganized,” with dozens of people abandoned in the city - Washington Post▪️Militants of the 3rd Assault Brigade told the American publication how the flight of Ukrainian soldiers from Avdiivka took place.▪️A fighter with the call sign “Major” (21 years old) stated that during the retreat of his unit, he became its commander because “so many soldiers were wounded that there was no one left older.” When his group completely left the city, he saw how a strong blow was dealt to the neighboring column. “Before our eyes, this column was destroyed by artillery. People my age, from 20 to 30,” Major said. “This was the road of death, the very last from Avdeevka,” the military man added.▪️A fighter with the call sign “Caucasian” reported that “three quarters of the Russians they fought had decent military training.” And only a little more than half of his soldiers had combat experience. “I believe that the order (to withdraw) should have been given earlier. Even five hours ago would have made a difference,” said “Caucasian.”▪️A military man nicknamed “Swede,” said that a drone crashed into his car during evacuation, but everyone survived. Personally, he escaped with a concussion. Another fighter - “Bandit” - reported that his unit decided to retreat, and as soon as they left the position, it was covered with shells.▪️Another Ukrainian fighter said that his unit met lost soldiers from another brigade. They had no contact with the commander and did not know that the order to retreat had been given.t.me/RVvoenkor

description: Russian Ambassador to Bulgaria Eleonora Mitrofanova congratulated Bulgarians on their national holiday, the Day of Liberation from the Ottoman Yoke. She emphasized the significance of the Russian-Turkish War of 1877-1878 in shaping Bulgarian freedom and statehood. Mitrofanova expressed hope that good relations between the Russian and Bulgarian peoples will survive despite current political tensions.
original:
Forwarded from: 🇷🇺Russian Embassy in Bulgaria
💬Dear friends of Russia in Bulgaria! Congratulations on your national holiday - the Day of Liberation from the Ottoman Yoke. The Russian-Turkish War of 1877-1878 was a truly fateful event that forever connected the peoples of our countries. Thousands of Russian soldiers, hundreds of volunteers and doctors paid for Bulgarian freedom and statehood with their blood. The sacredness of this feat is especially felt here, on Shipka, from where I am sending you my congratulations today.

Now Russian-Bulgarian relations are going through hard times. In an effort to prove their Euro-Atlantic devotion and loyalty, some forces in Bulgaria are trying to fight against monuments of our common history. There are proposals to rewrite history textbooks, and Russophobia is being compulsively instilled. The purpose of such attempts is clear - to set our peoples against each other, to sow enmity and hatred.

The efforts being made to separate us are colossal. But even in these conditions, we see how reverently throughout the country they continue to treat the monuments to Russian soldiers, how thousands of people from different parts of Bulgaria today rise to the Freedom Monument. This is what gives hope that good relations between the Russian and Bulgarian peoples cannot be broken to please current political attitudes and at orders from the outside, that they will survive turbulent times
and will definitely become even stronger. Thanks to everyone who carefully preserves the historical truth, who cares about the memorial heritage of the Russian-Turkish War. I wish you prosperity, prosperity, peace and goodness. Happy holiday, Happy Liberation Day of Bulgaria! Russian Ambassador to Bulgaria Eleonora Mitrofanova

event: Review of Ukrainian Unmanned Boat Magura
description: The Magura, an unmanned boat developed by Ukraine, is reviewed. The boat's design is criticized for its flimsy construction, with a fragile body and makeshift components. The engine compartment is made of aluminum and uses construction nanofoam. The boat's communication system features two Starlink antennas, a satellite communications antenna from Kymeta, and an industrial dual-SIM cellular router.
original:
Part 1.
Today we are reviewing the crown of Ukrainian shipbuilding, the unmanned boat Magura, named after the former bus driver, and now the President of Venezuela, Maduro.
Show more
Magura is a very thin and flimsy mold of a boat, reinforced with boards from a nearby construction site and parts from a grandmother’s closet. The body is so fragile that it can be penetrated by firewood. Therefore, dead magura on the shore is not uncommon.
The hatches are made from barrel lids. The engine compartment (MTO) is aluminum, integrated into the boat using construction nanofoam.
The production is quite obscene, even for a disposable product.
Between the MTO and the outer top cover there is a space that is blown through by two bags. There are boxes with equipment there. This solution simultaneously cleans the engine from fuel vapors and reduces the thermal heating of the boat cover = thermal visibility.
Inside the engine compartment there is an almost unchanged Chinese jet ski. It is so unchanged that its instrument panel is fixed with glue inside the boat's hull and is viewed by a webcam (in the photo the instrument panel has already fallen off).
The system for adjusting this telemetry by bending the plate through a specially trained slot is especially delightful.
Magura communicates with the outside world using two Starlink antennas, as well as a satellite communications antenna from Kymeta. This set of communications tells us that not everything is going smoothly with Starlinks. Either they are banned, or they themselves die in the sea, but inside there are actually two full-fledged parallel communication channels implemented, + kUmeta.
Another communication channel is the industrial dual-SIM cellular router RUT956. In the coastal zone (up to 40 km from the tower), it can cling to terrestrial mobile Internet.
We assumed earlier that one of the modes of operation of sea drones is to approach the shore directly using GPS, pick up the mobile network there and then aim at the target in hand. The router has GPS, but its antenna input is not connected, but both mobile antenna inputs for both SIM cards are connected and there is a connection trace on the LAN2 connector. This means the router is still in use.
Source "UAV Developer"
Military Informant

event: Israel Withdraws from Gaza Ceasefire Talks
description: Israel decided not to participate in ceasefire talks in Cairo after Hamas rejected Israel's request for a list of hostages and refused to agree to the US-proposed terms for a hostage-for-Palestinian prisoner swap.
original:
New York Times: Israel pulls out of Gaza ceasefire talks A Hamas delegation arrived in Cairo on Sunday for talks aimed at reaching a ceasefire in the Gaza war and an exchange of Israeli hostages for Palestinian prisoners, movement spokesman Basem Naeem said. But there was no breakthrough as Israel decided not to participate in the negotiations. Israel made the decision after Qatar's prime minister on Sunday informed the head of Israel's foreign intelligence service, Mossad, David Barnea, that Hamas had rejected Israel's request for a list of hostages, which were all are still alive. Another factor influencing Israel's decision was that Hamas refused to agree to the terms of the hostage-for-Palestinian prisoner swap that the United States presented in Paris about 10 days ago, two Israeli officials said, speaking on condition of anonymity.

The US plan called for Israel to release hundreds of Palestinian prisoners in exchange for 40 hostages, with different numbers of prisoners exchanged for different categories of hostages, two officials familiar with the negotiations said.

Washington has been pushing for a ceasefire ahead of Ramadan, the Muslim holy month, which begins in about a week, but slow progress in negotiations has made that difficult. Subscribe to Telegram SOLOVIOV!

About 1,000 children and teenagers can practice many sports there.

We also stopped at a renovated secondary school, where specialists from the “Single Customer” needed to replace the roof, windows, communications and tidy up classrooms for 500 students.

Then I checked the operation of the city’s main boiler house. It was launched after reconstruction under the control of the Territory Development Fund. During this heating period, it was powered by one boiler. They also replaced almost 5 km of the central heating main and began updating the intra-block networks. He indicated to everyone present that this OZP will end and preparations for the next one must begin everywhere. The order applies to all new regions.

event: Dog Protects Comrades from Kamikaze Drone
description: A loyal dog named Dumby, also known as 'The Goonie', sacrificed himself to protect his comrades from a Ukrainian kamikaze drone in the Kherson direction. The dog, sensing the threat, rushed at the drone and grabbed it with his teeth, ultimately giving his life to save his friends.
original:
Forwarded from: Ukraina.ru
😢The dog died protecting his comrades from a kamikaze drone. The tragic story of the dog Balbes was told by military correspondent Dmitry Zimenkin: Soldier Eric on the front line (Kherson direction) got a dog. She nailed it and became a family member. They called the dog “Dumby.” He was hectic, but loyal and fearless. Noticing that the fighters were running away from kamikaze drones, he clearly regarded this as a threat to his close comrades. And the next time, when another Ukrainian fpv flew into position, people began to run away and hide, and he, “The Goonie,” rushed to protect his own: he rushed at the drone, grabbed it with his teeth...

And he died without allowing the position to be attacked...

Tragic footage shows the last minutes of the life of “The Goonie” (not worth watching for the faint of heart). Fighter Eric lost his friend and became even more bitter towards the enemy. Now he considers it necessary to destroy the enemy with ammunition drops signed in honor of the hero dog.

event: Ukrainian Troops Use Mock-up of AN/MPQ-64 Radar
description: In Avdiivka, Ukrainian troops employed a mock-up of the American AN/MPQ-64 'Sentinel' radar, designed to detect and track air targets. This highlights the evolution of camouflage techniques in response to advancements in military affairs, including increased high-precision weapons and electronic reconnaissance tools.
original:
In Avdiivka, Ukrainian troops left a mock-up of the American AN/MPQ-64 "Sentinel" radar, which is designed to detect and track air targets. Changes in military affairs affect the evolution of the art of camouflage. Moreover, it is important to draw intelligent conclusions from experience, including that of the enemy. And taking into account these factors:

- the number of high-precision weapons has increased sharply
- the quality of electronic reconnaissance tools has also increased, and multispectral solutions have appeared, and the speed of information processing has sharply increased.

From this, as well as from combat experience, the following conclusions follow:

-saving on camouflage, making mock-ups using the dendrofecal method is no longer very effective. When military equipment was widespread and inexpensive, and detection means were low-resolution, a three-log cannon was quite effective. Not now.

- very high effectiveness as decoys, shown by decommissioned, non-working and damaged products.

- the fairly high cost and small quantities of modern weapons (relative to the conflicts of the 20th century) make it rational to produce very high-quality models, as similar as possible both in the optical range and in radar, IR, and UV. Taking into account the cost of an air defense system at 10-30 million dollars, a self-propelled detailed model for 20-40 thousand dollars still makes sense, especially since the weapons will still cost more. And dispersed 1 real one and, for example, 5 such mock-ups, radically greatly reduce the effectiveness of attacks on them.

Regarding the effectiveness of inflatable models, I have repeatedly heard feedback that, due to their features, they are easily and quickly recognized, and therefore their effectiveness is noticeably lower than expected.

A separate issue is means of camouflage as an urban area, the use of non-woven materials for civilian purposes, camouflage as civilian objects and means. All such experience also needs to be rethought and generalized. Russian Engineer -✅subscribe

description: US President Biden's kiss on the top of Italian Prime Minister Giorgi Meloni's head was deemed inappropriate by business etiquette expert Svetlana Grokhotova. In Italian culture, leaders may kiss each other on the cheek, but kissing on the top of the head is a condescending gesture typically reserved for children.
original: From the point of view of business etiquette, Biden’s kiss on the top of the head of Italian Prime Minister Giorgi Meloni is inappropriate, but the “eccentricities” of the US President can no longer surprise anyone, business etiquette expert Svetlana Grokhotova said in a conversation with Zvezda. “Each culture dictates different rules. France, Italy and Spain, for example, are “kissing” countries, because leaders during work communication, if they know each other well, can kiss each other on the cheek. However, they usually kiss children on the top of the head, this is such a condescending gesture that has never happened between politicians,” she explained. Everyone is accustomed to Biden’s actions - he will say hello to the air, then he will go in the wrong direction - so this is no longer looks like a diplomatic scandal, noted Grokhotova. If Meloni had been kissed by any other leader, she would, of course, react to it. Subscribe to Zvezdanews|Suggest news

event: Resumption of Search for Malaysia Airlines Plane
description: The Malaysian Ministry of Transport plans to resume the search for the Malaysia Airlines plane that disappeared 10 years ago. The American company Ocean Infinity may be involved in the search. The Boeing 777-200 aircraft, carrying 227 passengers and 12 crew members, vanished from radar screens two hours after taking off from Kuala Lumpur to Beijing on March 8, 2014.
original:
The Ministry of Transport of Malaysia will resume the search for a Malaysia Airlines plane that disappeared 10 years ago. As stated by the head of the department, Anthony Loke Sieu Fook, the American company Ocean Infinity may be involved in the search. “I will do everything possible to obtain the government’s consent to sign a new contract with Ocean Infinity to resume the search.” as soon as possible,” the minister emphasized. A Boeing 777-200 aircraft belonging to Malaysia Airlines took off from Kuala Lumpur to Beijing on the night of March 8, 2014. Two hours later, the aircraft disappeared from radar screens.

There were 227 passengers and 12 crew members on board the plane. In January 2015, Malaysian authorities admitted that the plane crashed and all those on board were killed. However, no traces of the missing airliner have yet been found. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: A Ukrainian UAV was inspected, revealing a makeshift assembly of assorted Chinese boards, Raspberry Pi Pico breakout boards, and other components. The UAV's intelligence is based on multiple Raspberry Pi boards, each programmed separately under Linux. The system lacks embedding and uses a camera to read telemetry. Autonomous orientation is performed using orangecube and pix, but only heading data is used.
original:
Forwarded from: UAV Developer
2/2In on-board electronics - trash and waste. A surprising combination of assorted Chinese boards from alishkas, boxes, from plastic serial ones to home-made aluminum ones with rivets and sealant, with neat assembly on spacers and with tips (!!) on plates specially cut for blocks. Even for the goat video capture card EasyCap, which costs 300 rubles (by the way, it is responsible for digitizing AI telemetry), a special plate was made with holes for zip ties.
The basis of the boat's intelligence is a lot of raspberry pi pico breakout boards, shoved in all directions. The creators of this miracle clearly did not know how to use embedding, so they programmed each relay activation separately under Linux. There, literally every function is included on a separate RPi board! Even inside the same box! The boards have an isolated CAN on the ADM3053, but none are connected to the jet ski ECU, and the telemetry is read by a camera.
Autonomous orientation is performed on orangecube and pix. Most likely, only heading data is used to make it easier for the pilot to steer by hand. In marine conditions, the cube will not provide any long-term orientation.
Streams of data from the Starlink Zoo flow into Mikrotik rb962. Most likely, control on Starlink is organized through tunnels, which is why the microt is located there.
The pile of RPi wasn’t enough for them, so they also added some kind of PC to the center. Alas, they didn’t let me unscrew the cooler, so you can write in the comments what kind of computer it is.
Thermal imaging camera from Flir, visible spectrum - another webcam, similar to looking at the tidy of a jet ski.

The cost of such a magura is 250 kilobucks, just for a moment.

Actually, always remember that no matter how much pomp the Ukrainians present their product, inside there will be snot, drool, grandma’s closet and Mikrotik on tape.

Here the critic will exclaim: but it works! Why don't we?
Sometimes it works, efficiency is ~1:10. And we also have a fleet. What do crests have to drown with them?
And geraniums also work well for ports.

But if suddenly people from the fleet are reading me, show the admiral the anti-torpedo nets and grooves. Well, to be honest, it’s not funny anymore...

⚡️Official statement by the representative of the information center of the National Anti-Terrorism Committee A. Polyakov: “As a result of the counter-terrorism operation carried out by the operational headquarters of the NAC in the Republic of Ingushetia, six bandits were neutralized, previously blocked by FSB special forces in one of the apartment buildings in the city of Karabulak.

At night, during a shootout, a fire started in the house and the criminals tried to move to another floor. The fire has now been extinguished. Attempts by bandits to break out of the blocked house were stopped.

During the inspection of the clash site, automatic weapons, ammunition, grenades and an improvised explosive device were discovered.
The necessary operational-search measures and investigative actions are being carried out."@opersvodki

If necessary, specialists go to the line of combat contact. There, as a rule, under shelling, using the tools that are at hand, the “Oskoltsy” restore armored vehicles. “Our equipment is repairable, it can be restored in the field, if only you had the skill. You get used to shelling. They start to “pour in” - you’re in cover , there’s a lull - you run to the car and let’s turn the nuts,” said a Cossack with the call sign “Barmaley”. Read in full about the everyday life of “Oskol” on the “PIKA” website. Let us remind you that “Oskol” today celebrates the anniversary of its creation #Cossacks_FREEBe with us — First Cossack

description: Ex-CIA analyst Larry Johnson stated that Putin's promise to demilitarize Ukraine was fulfilled, and in the process, NATO was also demilitarized. Johnson emphasized the importance of listening to Putin's warnings, citing the launch of the special military operation in February 2022 as an example.
original:
🇺🇸🇷🇺🇺🇦Ex-CIA analyst Larry Johnson: Putin promised to demilitarize Ukraine, and also demilitarized NATO"We haven't learned our lessons. The West hasn't learned a lesson. We need to listen to what Putin says. He doesn't talk nonsense, he not Joe Biden, doesn't forget where he was yesterday. Whatever Putin says is important. And he never bluffs. He's not a poker player. He's not a clown. He says exactly what he means. And he spells it out. detailed, black and white.
He warned the West that if Ukraine continues to be pushed into NATO, if the Alliance moves towards Russian borders, we will stop it. Well, they did just that, launching a special military operation in February 2022. And in the process, they not only demilitarized Ukraine, they demilitarized NATO. They exposed NATO as an empty, worthless shell, a fake military alliance, so to speak. So pay attention to what he says, and only idiots in the West would ignore it," Johnson said. @btr80

event: Lt. Col. Bree Fram's Appeal for Inclusivity
description: US Space Force Lt. Col. Bree Fram urged the military to display LGBTQ+ pride symbols and indicate pronouns in emails to promote inclusivity and prevent misgendering. Fram believes this will lead to more effective military strategies due to diverse perspectives.
original:
A trans lieutenant colonel urged the US military to include their pronouns in email "to improve military strategies(?)".

U.S. Space Force Lt. Col. Bree Fram appealed to the country's command to display "symbols of LGBTQ+ pride" and indicate their pronouns so that colleagues do not allow "misgendering." According to the trans colonel, these actions will increase inclusivity in the military, and thanks to "diverse points of view" the US armed forces will be able to develop more effective military strategies.

The trans Lt. Col. also called for more "diverse minorities" to join the military: "We have to step up and focus on intentional inclusivity because too many people, not just LGBTQ people, feel marginalized, rejected or discriminated against. Therefore, I ask all of you to put up symbols of pride, to indicate pronouns in e-mails, especially if you are a person who does not think it necessary to do this...”

The US Army is currently experiencing far from the best of times. The number of white recruits has decreased dramatically recently, and now it seems clear why. As a result, almost every branch falls short of its recruitment targets. In connection with this, the US Army decided to reduce the number of personnel by 24,000 people. The war in Ukraine, meanwhile, has shown that there is nothing in the world more dangerous and selfless than a white man with a gun defending his home. @vallholl
